summary:
In 1969, Apollo 11 made history by landing on the Moon. Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin were the first humans to walk on its surface. They spent over two hours exploring and collected lunar samples. Michael Collins piloted the command module, Columbia, while the other two were on the Moon.

The mission began on July 16th with a Saturn V rocket launch from Florida. After a three-day journey, they orbited the Moon, and Armstrong and Aldrin landed their lunar module, Eagle, in the Sea of Tranquility. They returned safely to Earth on July 24th, splashing down in the Pacific Ocean.

This achievement marked the end of the Space Race, fulfilling President Kennedy's goal of landing a man on the Moon.
title: Apollo 11
